lexUnit.name: disrespect.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: lack of respect or courtesy.

sentence.text: ` If we change the name , we show disrespect for all of the good things the party has done for Poland . "
All four are united by a healthy disrespect for dominant tastes and the remains of a reputation for exposing new talent before the industry finds it .
He also shows a healthy disrespect for the over-specialised , and is as much at home with the nuts and bolts of medical practice as he is with basic research in the laboratory .

Here , too , Richard Titmuss 's exposure of the inadequacies of the ` residual " model of the welfare state bears re-examination : so does his healthy disrespect for econometric models as a foundation for social policy .
The same crusading disrespect for authority has characterized his life ever since .
The most disturbing threat to our freedom and security is the growing disrespect for the rule of law .
Nonetheless , disrespect for the law and the general customs of society are commonly a sign of addictive disease .
Esteem for the scholar is matched by disrespect for the general .
It is little wonder that the private sector mimics the Government in its disrespect for pensions .
To disregard that is to show disrespect for those who are colleagues , those whom the head is leading and without whose support he or she can not manage .

Much as he mistrusted almost every Irishman with whom he came in contact on the Continent ( Bishop Clement for his disrespect of patristic authority , the priest Sampson for his cavalier attitude to the baptismal rite , Virgil of Salzburg for sowing dissension between himself and the duke of Bavaria as well as for believing that the world was round ) , Boniface 's establishing of monasteries as the learned back-up to missionary work and his devotion to the papacy and to Rome both owed something to the Irish background in England .
It is with no disrespect to her that I give him preference .
Without any disrespect to them , we appreciate that Howard Wilkinson is n't the sort of a manager to make that decision without a lot of thought .
` No disrespect to John Beck , but the club has been happier since he left . "
No disrespect to my conveyancing brethren but I would n't let them loose on a guilty plea of going the wrong way round a keep left sign .

Had he shown disrespect to their dead ?
They mean no disrespect to your ma . "

Marius Steen was often criticized for his healthy disrespect for ` Art " and there are many stories of this supposed philistinism which he loved to tell against himself ( On first hearing of Michelangelo , he is reputed to have asked ` Michael who ? "
` No disrespect intended , Captain , " said George .

He did n't treat you with disrespect -- he just assumed you were a mere mortal like the rest of us .
